message.content:
cs.HC, cs.SI, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.CV 

This paper focuses on the perception of vibrotactile texture and proposes a method using a pseudo-haptic effect to modulate fine roughness perception. The study involves user perception and interaction with virtual surfaces, which suggests a strong connection to human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and social and information networks (cs.SI). The use of visual modification and oscillation also suggests a connection to graphics (cs.GR) and multimedia (cs.MM). Additionally, the study involves analyzing and processing visual data, which suggests a connection to computer vision (cs.CV).
